summary: This is an Office of the Inspector General (OIG) memorandum documenting the voluntary interview of a Federal Bureau of Prisons Senior Officer Specialist (SOS) regarding the events surrounding the death of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The SOS details his assignment, procedures in the Special Housing Unit (SHU), and his specific activities and knowledge on August 9, 2019, the day before Epstein's death, stating he was never informed that Epstein required a new cellmate after his previous one was released.

events.title: Epstein's Last Full Day in Custody
events.description: The day before Jeffrey Epstein's death. The interviewee worked a shift on the SHU, noting Epstein was in an attorney conference room all day and his cellmate, Efrain Reyes, was released, leaving Epstein without a cellmate.

events.title: Epstein's Initial Suicide Attempt
events.description: The interviewee learned about Jeffrey Epstein's initial suicide attempt in July 2019 upon returning from military orders.

events.title: OIG Interview of BOP SOS
events.description: The Office of the Inspector General and FBI special agents interviewed a BOP Senior Officer Specialist regarding the events surrounding Epstein's death.

locations: United States Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York, 1 Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York
keyFacts: The interviewed BOP Senior Officer Specialist stated he was never informed that Jeffrey Epstein required a new cellmate after Efrain Reyes was released on August 9, 2019, contradicting other potential accounts.
The officer described staffing levels at MCC New York as 'abysmal' and stated standard 30-minute inmate checks were often not performed as required, especially on shower days.
On August 9, 2019, the officer's shift began at ~8:45 AM; Epstein was already in an attorney conference room and never returned to the SHU during that shift, and Reyes was already gone.
The officer asserted that if he had been told Epstein needed a cellmate, he would have ensured it happened, but no one—including Captain, Lieutenant, Psychology Department, or SOS Roberto—told him.
The document reveals operational challenges and potential failures in protocol at MCC New York's SHU in the period leading up to Epstein's death.
